reviewText: The aromatic rice, tender mutton pieces, and perfectly cooked potatoes made for an authentic and deeply satisfying Kachchi Biryani. A true taste of Dhaka's culinary tradition.
Crispy fuchka shells filled with spicy mashed potato, drizzled with tangy tamarind water and a sprinkle of grated egg. The perfect street food experience!

foodName: Panta Bhat and Ilish Maach Bhaja
reviewText: Submerged rice (Panta Bhat) served with perfectly fried Hilsa (Ilish) fish. A seasonal Bengali delicacy that truly captures the flavor of the region. Simply fantastic.
The Hilsa was fresh, and the rich mustard gravy (Shorshe) was pungent and spicyâ€”exactly how authentic Shorshe Ilish should be. A must-try for fish lovers.
The fragrant rice and lentil preparation was perfectly seasoned. Paired with a juicy beef rezala, it made for a comforting and hearty meal.
The spiced water (pani) was a perfect blend of sweet, sour, and spicy. Crisp puris and generous fillings. Easily the best I've had outside of Dhaka.
The contrast of the cool, sweet yogurt with the spicy filling was excellent. A refreshing twist on the classic fuchka. Highly recommend the savory-sweet balance.
The Polao rice was fluffy and fragrant, perfectly complementing the rich, creamy, and mildly spiced Mutton Korma. Ideal for special occasions.
The signature Morog Polao lived up to the hype. The chicken was incredibly tender, and the rice was deeply flavorful with a perfect spice balance. A very satisfying meal.
Rich, creamy, and with just the right level of caramelization and sweetness. This Mishti Doi is the perfect authentic Bengali dessert. Smooth texture and beautiful presentation.
The iconic Chattogram delicacy. Dark, slow-cooked beef with a deeply roasted flavor from the specific spice mix. Served with parotta, it's an intensely savory and flavorful dish.
Crispy outer shell and a well-spiced filling of potato and peanuts. The perfect rainy-day snack paired with a cup of tea. Simple, fresh, and delicious.
